uk.ac.ebi.mdk.service.query
Class AbstractLuceneService<I extends Identifier>

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ebi.mdk.service.AbstractService<I>
      uk.ac.ebi.mdk.service.query.AbstractLuceneService<I>
All Implemented Interfaces:
QueryService<I>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractCrossreferenceService, AbstractStructureQueryService, BioCycNameService, ChEBIDataService, ChEBINameService, HMDBDataService, HMDBNameService, KEGGCompoundDataService, KEGGCompoundNameService, LipidMapsNameService, TaxonomyQueryService
public abstract class AbstractLuceneService<I extends Identifier>
extends AbstractService<I>
implements QueryService<I>

AbstractLuceneService - 23.02.2012

Provides a base for which other lucene query services can build upon. This class provides a lot of utility methods for building queries, accessing score docs and field values.

Version:
$Rev$
Author:
johnmay, $Author$ (this version)

startup

public boolean startup()
Description copied from interface: QueryService
Determine whether the service is available for use. In the case of a database/webservice connection this method should return false if a connection could not be made. In the case of a lucene index service the index is checked whether it is available

Specified by:

whether the service is available

first

public org.apache.lucene.search.ScoreDoc first(org.apache.lucene.search.Query query)
Convenience method to access the first score document for a given query. If multiple documents are found then an warning is logged.

Parameters:
query - search-able query
Returns:
the first score document for the query

search

public org.apache.lucene.search.ScoreDoc[] search(org.apache.lucene.search.Query query)
Search the index with the provided query. A new TopScoreDocCollector is created using and constrained using the value of AbstractService.getMaxResults(). If an exception occurs an empty array of ScoreDoc's is returned.

Parameters:
query - search-able query
Returns:
the score documents for the query

search

                                                  org.apache.lucene.search.TopScoreDocCollector collector)
Search the index with the provided query and TopScoreDocCollector. If an exception occurs an empty array of ScoreDoc's is returned

Parameters:
query - search-able query
collector - the TopScoreDocCollector to use
Returns:
the score documents

parse

public org.apache.lucene.search.Query parse(String query,
                                            org.apache.lucene.index.Term term)
Parse the query for the given term/field. This method will use the appropriate query parser to construct a query from the 'query' parameter. This allows flexibility when creating a query and parsing of more complex searches: 

// variable length query
      parse("start of a name*", NameService.NAME);

Parameters:
query - string query
term - the field to search
Returns:
searchable query

construct

public org.apache.lucene.search.Query construct(String text,
                                                org.apache.lucene.index.Term term)
Construct a non-approximate query without using the QueryParser. This is useful when you want to search an field that is analyzed and maintain space's. The token stream is converted into a boolean 'Must Occur' query. For most simple queries this method can be used.

Parameters:
text - text to construct the query for
term - the field to search the text in
Returns:
searchable query

construct

public org.apache.lucene.search.Query construct(String text,
                                                org.apache.lucene.index.Term term,
                                                boolean approximate)
Construct a query without using the QueryParser. This is useful when you want to search an field that is analyzed and maintain space's. The token stream is converted into a boolean 'Must Occur' query. For most simple queries this method can be used. The approximate flag allows construction of approximate FuzzyMatch queries for each token. The similarity for the fuzzy match can be set via the AbstractService.setMinSimilarity(float) method.

Parameters:
text - text to construct the query for
term - the field to search the text in
approximate - whether to use approximate search
Returns:
searchable query

construct

public org.apache.lucene.search.Query construct(String text,
                                                boolean approximate,
                                                org.apache.lucene.index.Term... terms)

construct

public org.apache.lucene.search.Query construct(String text,
                                                org.apache.lucene.index.Term[] terms,
                                                boolean approximate)

firstValue

public String firstValue(Identifier identifier,
                         org.apache.lucene.index.Term term)
Convenience method that allows retrieval of the a value in the given term/field for the provided identifier. An example would be accessing the preferred name for an identifier. 

return firstValue(identifier, PreferredNameService.PREFERRED_NAME);

Parameters:
identifier - identifier to search for
term - the term/field to access
Returns:
value stored in the field for the identifier (empty string it not found)

firstValues

public Collection<String> firstValues(Identifier identifier,
                                      org.apache.lucene.index.Term term)
Convenience method that allows retrieval of the all values in the given term for the provided identifier. An example would be accessing all synonyms for an identifier. 

return firstValues(identifier, SynonymService.SYNONYM);

Parameters:
identifier - identifier to search for
term - the term/field to access
Returns:
collection of values

firstBinaryValue

public byte[] firstBinaryValue(org.apache.lucene.search.Query query,
                               org.apache.lucene.index.Term term)
Convenience method to access the value for the specified field in the first document returned by the query. If no values are found an empty array is returned. If multiple are found the first is returned.

Parameters:
query - the search query
term - field to access
Returns:
binary value for specified field in the first document

Access the value for the specified field in the first document returned by the query. If no values are found an empty array is returned. If multiple are found the first is returned.

Parameters:
query - the search query
field - field to access
Returns:
binary value for specified field in the first document

firstValues

public Collection<String> firstValues(org.apache.lucene.search.Query query,
                                      org.apache.lucene.index.Term term)
Convenience method to access the all-values for the specified field in the first document returned by the query. If no values are found an empty collection is returned.

Parameters:
query - the search query
term - term to access
Returns:
all values for specified field in the first document

firstValues

public Collection<String> firstValues(org.apache.lucene.search.Query query,
                                      String field)
Access the all-values for the specified field in the first document returned by the query. If no values are found an empty collection is returned.

Parameters:
query - the search query
field - field to access
Returns:
all values for specified field in the first document

values

public Collection<String> values(org.apache.lucene.search.Query query,
                                 org.apache.lucene.index.Term term)
Convenience method to access the values for the specified field for all score documents returned by the query. If multiple values exists for the term only the first value will be returned. To access multi-value fields for each document please use allValues(Query, Term).Null values are suppressed and not returned, if no values match and empty collection is returned.

Parameters:
query - search query
term - the term to access the value for
Returns:
ranked list of the first value of the specified field for each document returned by the query

values

public Collection<String> values(org.apache.lucene.search.Query query,
                                 String field)
Access the values for the specified field for all score documents returned by the query. If multiple values exists for the field only the first value will be returned. To access multi value fields for each document please use allValues(Query, Term). Null values are suppressed and not returned, if no values match and empty collection is returned.

Parameters:
query - search query
field - the field to access the value for
Returns:
ranked list of the first value of the specified field for each document returned by the query

allValues

public Collection<String> allValues(org.apache.lucene.search.Query query,
                                    org.apache.lucene.index.Term term)
Convenience method to access using a given term. This method allows access to the values for the specified term. If multiple values exists all values for that term will be added to the returned collection. Null values are suppressed and not returned, if no values match and empty collection is returned.

Parameters:
query - search query
term - the field term to retrieve the values for
Returns:
Aggregated collection of values from single or multi-value fields

allValues

public Collection<String> allValues(org.apache.lucene.search.Query query,
                                    String field)
Access the values for the specified field. If multiple values exists all values for that field will be added to the returned collection. Null values are suppressed and not returned, if no values match and empty collection is returned.

Parameters:
query - search query
field - the field to retrieve the values for
Returns:
Aggregated collection of values from single or multi-value fields

getIdentifiers

public Collection<I> getIdentifiers(org.apache.lucene.search.Query query)
Access a collection of identifiers for the given query. If you have duplicate identifier fields in your index this method's return may contain duplicate also. The identifier's are constructed from the QueryService.IDENTIFIER field an subsequently if that field is missing an empty set is returned.

Parameters:
query - the query to search for
Returns:
Ranked list of identifiers for the given query
